history.content:
You can take class via the Berkeley Extension program. You get a $50 discount if you are a member of the Cal Alumni Association, and you have to email the Extension staff for this.

Another option is that you can contact the professor teaching the class you're interested in and ask if you can audit. Many professor in my experience are very open to auditors from industry or another major. Auditing won't give you any credit if you want to apply to grad school latter on, but it's a good option if you just want to take the class for fun.

You can take class via the Berkeley Extension program. I don't know if being an alumni will give you a discount.

Another option is that you can contact the professor teaching the class you're interested in and ask if you can audit. Many professor in my experience are very open to auditors from industry or another major. Auditing won't give you any credit if you want to apply to grad school latter on, but it's a good option if you just want to take the class for fun.

You can take class via the Berkeley Extension programs. I don't know if being an alumni will give you a discount.

Another option is that you can contact the professor teaching the class you're interested in and ask if you can audit. Many professor in my experience are very open to auditors from industry or another major. Auditing won't give you any credit if you want to apply to grad school latter on, but it's a good option if you just want to take the class for fun.

There were a couple of CS courses I wish I could have taken while a student, but I simply did not have the time to before I needed to graduate.

Now that we are in lockdown, I have extra time outside of work to pursue a couple of classes that I wanted to take earlier.

Is there a way I can do this?

If it matters I was a CS major (graduated Fall 2018) and I want to take CS classes.
